metadata.title: CVE-2021-22945 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: When sending data to an MQTT server, libcurl <= 7.73.0 and 7.78.0 could in some circumstances erroneously keep a pointer to an already freed memory area and both use that again in a subsequent call to send data and also free it *again*.

notes.note: amurray> MQTT sending support is only present in curl >= 7.70 - see Message-ID: <nycvar.QRO.7.76.2109061032590.1742@fvyyl>

criterions.comment: curl package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.74.0-1ubuntu2.3').
